requests.description: Returns an object with the current configuration that Buffer is using, including supported services, their icons and the varying limits of character and schedules.
Returns an object with a the numbers of shares a link has had using Buffer.

queryParams.description: URL-encoded URL of the page for which the number of shares is requested.

requests.description: "Set the posting schedules for the specified social media profile.
Returns details of the posting schedules associated with a social media profile.
"Returns an array of updates that are currently in the buffer for an individual social media profile.

queryParams.description: Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.
Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.
Specifies a unix timestamp which only status updates created after this time will be retrieved.
If utc is set times will be returned relative to UTC rather than the users associated timezone.

requests.description: Edit the order at which statuses for the specified social media profile will be sent out of the buffer.
Returns an array of updates that have been sent from the buffer for an individual social media profile.

queryParams.description: Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.
Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.
Specifies a unix timestamp which only status updates created after this time will be retrieved.
If utc is set times will be returned relative to UTC rather than the users associated timezone.

requests.description: Randomize the order at which statuses for the specified social media profile will be sent out of the buffer.
Returns details of the single specified social media profile.
Returns an array of social media profiles connected to a users account.
Create one or more new status updates.
Permanently delete an existing status update.
Returns the detailed information on individual interactions with the social media update such as favorites, retweets and likes.

queryParams.description: Specifies a type of event to be retrieved, for example "retweet", "like", "comment", "mention" or "reshare". They can also be plural (e.g., "reshares"). Plurality has no effect other than visual semantics. See /info/configuration for more information on supported interaction events.
Specifies the page of status updates to receive. If not specified the first page of results will be returned.
Specifies the number of status updates to receive. If provided, must be between 1 and 100.

requests.description: Move an existing status update to the top of the queue and recalculate times for all updates in the queue. Returns the update with its new posting time.
Immediately shares a single pending update and recalculates times for updates remaining in the queue.
Edit an existing, individual status update.
Returns a single social media update.
Returns a single user.
